feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly built and ran a functioning financial application that analyzes invest vs. debt-payoff decisions: they stated the goal, executed workflows with nodes that "executed correctly," and produced financial outputs/data. Driver evidence (Discover, Implement, Reflect) shows the tool both performs financial tasks and was validated, meeting the PASS criterion.
- Integrate AI: The student implemented an AI-backed workflow that ingests inputs, calls an AI model, and returns structured, actionable outputs (recommendation, key findings, action plan), demonstrating functional integration that adds value. Iterations, execution evidence, and reflection on verification support that the AI use is substantive, not superficial, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "our goal is to build a more advanced AI finance tool"
"And we can see here each node executed correctly."
"this has been my mini project 3 where we've analyzed whether you should invest or pay off debt"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified a clear financial problem (invest vs. pay off debt) and project goal; Implement — executed workflows/nodes, used an API key, and populated a data table demonstrating the tool runs; Reflect — iterated and verified outputs, noting accuracy and possible improvements.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly built and ran a functioning financial application that analyzes invest vs. debt-payoff decisions: they stated the goal, executed workflows with nodes that "executed correctly," and produced financial outputs/data. Driver evidence (Discover, Implement, Reflect) shows the tool both performs financial tasks and was validated, meeting the PASS criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "so I was able to use the assistance of the NAN AI to help kind of give me some ideas on, you know, different parameters and nodes that, uh, I wanted to execute here."
"I was able to use the same API key that I got for the second mini project"
"We have our recommendation here, our key findings, action plan, uh reasoning, important considerations."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: defined a concrete problem (invest vs. pay off debt) and rationale for AI assistance ("our goal is to build a more advanced AI finance tool"), showing intent to integrate AI purposefully.
- Implement: used NAN/OpenAI in an n8n workflow, reused API key, built nodes and executed the workflow ("each node executed correctly"), demonstrating actual technical integration.
- Reflect: iterated and verified outputs ("a couple hours of work and a few iterations... made something that actually did work") and considered limitations/validation, indicating thoughtful use of AI rather than superficial inclusion.
criteria.reasoning: The student implemented an AI-backed workflow that ingests inputs, calls an AI model, and returns structured, actionable outputs (recommendation, key findings, action plan), demonstrating functional integration that adds value. Iterations, execution evidence, and reflection on verification support that the AI use is substantive, not superficial, meeting the PASS standard.
